channel.title: Behance Network Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance Network

item.title: IMDB Filmpage Concept
item.description: What don`t have the current IMDB design? It is overloaded. Large amount of unstructured information. While most users of such sites pay attention mainly to the pictures, videos and more. So I did a clean and sleek design. Here, the user receives a screen on which there is information about the film: photos, actors, trailers, storyline and more. He does not have to twist, twirl, to read. All that is needed - is to look at the screen. If the information is insufficient, then click the arrow and get the second screen. Also I integrated the viewing of the film on NetFlix and purchase at Amazon. Those who love to read click on sections below.
item.content:encoded: What don`t have the current IMDB design? It is overloaded. Large amount of unstructured information. While most users of such sites pay attention mainly to the pictures, videos and more. So I did a clean and sleek design. Here, the user receives a screen on which there is information about the film: photos, actors, trailers, storyline and more. He does not have to twist, twirl, to read. All that is needed - is to look at the screen. If the information is insufficient, then click the arrow and get the second screen. Also I integrated the viewing of the film on NetFlix and purchase at Amazon. Those who love to read click on sections below.

item.title: Rapture series
item.description: The pursuit of release or transcendence occur most purely within the seemingly opposing natures of religion and 'sin'. This is dealt with explicitly in my Rapture series, the inspiration for which originated from my interest in Bernini's sculpture 'The Ecstasy of St.Teresa' and how Bernini visualised 'religious ecstasy' in an abstract form and inadvertently drew comparisons to psycho-sexual release: "He appeared to me to be thrusting it at times into my heart, and to pierce my very entrails; when he drew it out, he seemed to draw them out also, and to leave me all on fire with a great love of God. The pain was so great, that it made me moan; and yet so surpassing was the sweetness of this excessive pain, that I could not wish to be rid of it." (Life of St.Teresa of Jesus St.Teresa) This is explicitly symbolised in the Rapture series by the use of porn stars as the vehicle for the expression of this 'spiritual' emotion, the shedding of carnal bodies giving way to an abstract purity beneath. The idea of release from the material to the spiritual is apparent in many religions as if there were a divine soul trapped in our earthly bodies, this is analogous to contemporary imagery found in comic books specifically the way in which Clark Kent, a normal man, sheds his clothes to become a Superman.
item.content:encoded: The pursuit of release or transcendence occur most purely within the seemingly opposing natures of religion and 'sin'. This is dealt with explicitly in my Rapture series, the inspiration for which originated from my interest in Bernini's sculpture 'The Ecstasy of St.Teresa' and how Bernini visualised 'religious ecstasy' in an abstract form and inadvertently drew comparisons to psycho-sexual release: "He appeared to me to be thrusting it at times into my heart, and to pierce my very entrails; when he drew it out, he seemed to draw them out also, and to leave me all on fire with a great love of God. The pain was so great, that it made me moan; and yet so surpassing was the sweetness of this excessive pain, that I could not wish to be rid of it." (Life of St.Teresa of Jesus St.Teresa) This is explicitly symbolised in the Rapture series by the use of porn stars as the vehicle for the expression of this 'spiritual' emotion, the shedding of carnal bodies giving way to an abstract purity beneath. The idea of release from the material to the spiritual is apparent in many religions as if there were a divine soul trapped in our earthly bodies, this is analogous to contemporary imagery found in comic books specifically the way in which Clark Kent, a normal man, sheds his clothes to become a Superman.

item.title: Allegheny Financial
item.description: Corporate identity for a property developer. Through a subtle use of Didot we've created a website, stationery, bags, mugs, as well as the 2011(in latin MMXI) collateral that includes a screen-printed corporate planner, red foiled calender and the Christmas card.
item.content:encoded: Corporate identity for a property developer. Through a subtle use of Didot we've created a website, stationery, bags, mugs, as well as the 2011(in latin MMXI) collateral that includes a screen-printed corporate planner, red foiled calender and the Christmas card.

item.title: Untitled for WAD magazine number 49
item.description: For this new issue about street and urban ways of traveling , WAD magazine offers us a free space of creation. Using vintage and hi-tech pieces from AS DE PIQUE, we create sculptures and mobiles. A tribute to the geometric contructions of Kandinsky, and the abstract art of Calder & Miro
item.content:encoded: For this new issue about street and urban ways of traveling , WAD magazine offers us a free space of creation. Using vintage and hi-tech pieces from AS DE PIQUE, we create sculptures and mobiles. A tribute to the geometric contructions of Kandinsky, and the abstract art of Calder & Miro

item.title: The Dream Room
item.description: Liljevalchs in Stockholm has invited 13 of Swedens most prominent experts on antiquities and provided them with a gallery each. In contrast to their normal line of work with other peoples objects, they have been assigned to capture and share their passion for collecting. The result is 13 personal dream rooms, which provide the audience with insights into the powerful drives behind collecting and especially the strong love for objects and their histories.
item.content:encoded: Liljevalchs in Stockholm has invited 13 of Swedens most prominent experts on antiquities and provided them with a gallery each. In contrast to their normal line of work with other peoples objects, they have been assigned to capture and share their passion for collecting. The result is 13 personal dream rooms, which provide the audience with insights into the powerful drives behind collecting and especially the strong love for objects and their histories.

item.title: MSCED
item.description: Throughout 2011 I will do something creative each day. In most cases this will be some piece of graphic design on a subject that stirs my interests, or simply based on a photograph I've made or found. Follow the progress on msced.mariusroosendaal.com.
item.content:encoded: Throughout 2011 I will do something creative each day. In most cases this will be some piece of graphic design on a subject that stirs my interests, or simply based on a photograph I've made or found. Follow the progress on msced.mariusroosendaal.com.

item.title: Bayer Vision Project
item.description: This is a project for the Master of Design (MDes) at Hong Kong Polytechnic University under the direction of Prof. Peter Dean in collaboration with Bayer Plastics. The project explores an innovative plastic coating material, Lyttron. It is a EL (electroluminescent) film coating that can be applied on many plastics. The various objects attempts to utilize this property to create innovative lighting and display furniture pieces for the home as well as retail environments.
item.content:encoded: This is a project for the Master of Design (MDes) at Hong Kong Polytechnic University under the direction of Prof. Peter Dean in collaboration with Bayer Plastics. The project explores an innovative plastic coating material, Lyttron. It is a EL (electroluminescent) film coating that can be applied on many plastics. The various objects attempts to utilize this property to create innovative lighting and display furniture pieces for the home as well as retail environments.

item.title: Eternal Moments / Animated Photos
item.description: "What the Photograph reproduces to infinity has occurred only once: the Photograph mechanically repeats what could never be repeated existentially." Roland Barthes (Camera Lucida: Reflections on Photography)

item.title: YWFT Pello
item.description: YWFT Pello has three weights (light, regular and bold), includes Opentype features like contextual alternates, fractions, and ligatures, and contains 265 glyph designs.
item.content:encoded: YWFT Pello has three weights (light, regular and bold), includes Opentype features like contextual alternates, fractions, and ligatures, and contains 265 glyph designs.
